main event: A pilot and a passenger aboard a C-47 aircraft sighted a blue-white flame while flying 85 miles N.W. of Jacksonville, Florida.
interesting points: The blue-white flame was about 60 to 75 feet long,The pilot initially thought it was a falling star,Neither the co-pilot nor the engineer noticed the flame,The sighting lasted about 15 - 20 seconds,The report was documented and addressed to the Commanding General of the Air Force.
witness description: 1st Lt. J. K. Hahn, pilot and T/Sgt. L. H. Young, passenger
